lom:description.lom:string:
Syllabus for a seminar covering issues for ethnic minorities and women in science and engineering. The goals of the course are to (1) inform students of issues faced by women and ethnic minorities in science and engineering, providing both a national and local context (2) Introduce students to expert women and minority practitioners of science, as well as expert social scientists, who study and/or experience these issues
(3) Enable students to critically evaluate both the framing of issues facing women and minorities in science and engineering and the effectiveness of solutions
(4) Prepare students to address these issues in the context of their own disciplines and institutions.
Keywords: African American, Hispanic, Chicano, Native American, Women Engineers

lom:title.lom:string: Issues for Ethnic Minorities and Women in Science and Engineering
